chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) .266. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) .266 was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert D. Beson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert D. Beson in court.   
4:27
Court reviews case - $588 left - $352 was paid today- leaving balance of $236 Court will extend to 5-1  Review hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

2:53 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court.  Court recites record. Defendant states he moved from LacduFlambeau to Rhinelander for better job opportunity. Is now employed at Fosters & Smith. Gets paid on 17th and 31st. Defendant will be receiving approx $755/every two weeks. Court orders defendant to pay balance in full by next court hearing - if received no appearance is required. Adj. 2:58 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

4:09 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court.  Defendant states he has per capita payment in his pocket - did not know if he should pay prior to court. Has not done community service hours. Has $750.00 today. Court directs defendant to pay today with Clerk of Court - Defendant may provide community service documentation prior to next court and must obtain permission from Branch 2 JA to cancel court date. Adj. 4:12 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court.  Court recites record. Defendant states he could not arrange for $500 but brought $200 and documentation for tribal per capita notice to be received in November. Court will accept $200 payment today and orders defendant to pay $750, attend review hearing on November 21, 2016 and bring documentation of community service performed only in connection with community service for this case. Adj. 1:47 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
LDF correspondence and hours worked (credit given for 12 hours)

3:44 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court. Defendant presents documentation for community service hours - Court reviews - Defendant has no money with him today. Court orders defendant to return on Friday with $500. Adj. 3:49 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

3:51 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.   Court reviews record. Burns provides community service hours worked documentation. Court questions defendant regarding documentation - Court schedules review hearing - wants appropriate documentation of community service hours brought to court or will have to pay $500 or will be remanded. Documentation not filed with clerk - returned to defendant. Adj. 3:59 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

4:31 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Defendant has not obtained employment - has been mowing lawns just to get by. Court will approve community service hours. Defendant must make substantial payments or perform substantial amount of community service by next court date. Adj. 4:35 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court, in custody, via video. Court recites record. Defendant states he gets his "kids" this summer and will pay his fine for sure; does not want his children to see him get arrested. States he guarantees fine will be paid in full by next review date-only has $400 left.  Court explains process of time served/credit-Defendant does not get to determine credited amount. Court allows credit of $1,000 for time served against fine. Court expects balance of $630 paid by July 11, 2016. Credit contingent upon payment of balance by 7/11/16 or appearing in court on that date and providing sufficient explanation to Court for non-payment. If Defendant does not show or pay in full by 07-11-16, $1000 credit is vacated. Adj. 1:42 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

3:05 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court via video in custodywith attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Burns statement that defendant has made two payments of $100 - Court states those payments were made prior to warrant. Defendant states he has not received check from Burger King. Defendant states he could maybe get a friend to post $200. Court will accept $200 cash payment - Defendant to be released with $200 payment. Adj. 3:11 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:22 p.m. Defendant Robert D. Beson in court, in custody via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance/non payment. Defendant states he didn't have a ride on court date and was taking care of his mother. Started working at Burger King 3 weeks ago - gets paid either today or next week - was going to start making his payments. Family members take him to work - he does not have a driver's license. Defendant requests $50 monthly payment because he has to pay for gas money to get to work. Court approves payment plan of $100/month - to be released from jail $1000 payment needs to be made. Defendant expects Burger King check to be about $300.00. Adj. 1:30 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Per Brandi in ONSO _ warrant fee added
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
$200 was posted

Defendant Robert D. Beson in court, via video  in custody.
1:54
Br II Case - Defendant owes $1830 - sent letter wanting payment plan -warrant active since July 2015 - 0 payments  -gives statement to non appearance/non payments - Court will release upon payment of $200 then to pay $100/month - Sets for review in br II  Review hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
03:44 pm - Defendant Robert D. Beson in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss counts 2 through 4 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).  Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Fine $1805 (Inclusive of all costs)
Jail 85 days w/Huber for all purposes - Jail credit 1 day - To commence on/before 04-17-15 at 4 pm
DL revocation 15 months
IID 12 months
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
DNA Sample
Appeal rights given  Review hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:04 pm - Defendant Robert D. Beson in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No intoxicants, No taverns.  May not operate MV unless properly licensed

Defendant Robert D. Beson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:34
In receipt, right to counsel - has PD in Vilas County case - will contact PDs office
MIchlig to bail - Court sets $ sig bond -  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
